message.content:
Geranium sanguineum, commonly known as bloody cranesbill, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and Asia.

It usually grows to a height of 15-30 cm and has a spread of 30-60 cm.

The leaves of Geranium sanguineum are deeply lobed and green in color, and the flowers are usually bright pink or magenta.

The flowers have five petals and a white center, and are about 2-3 cm wide.

Blooming occurs from late spring to early summer, and the plant prefers a sunny location with well-draining soil.

Geranium sanguineum is widely used in landscaping and gardening as a border or edging plant, as well as in rock gardens and wildflower meadows.

The plant also has medicinal properties and has been used traditionally to treat a variety of ailments, including diarrhea, sore throat, and respiratory issues.
